Reviews.Title: “Good location/Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cctravelerCctx
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel after reading reviews from this site. For the money it proved to be a very good choice. The staff couldn't be more helpful and there was always someone at the front desk willing to address any query. A request for a room facing the lagoon was fulfilled and although we didn't actually sit outside the view was breathtaking each morning. Being located where "it's happening" comes with some noise at times but nothing I didn't sleep through. Breakfast was fine. There were enough choices to satisfy and the cappicino was very good. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bsacboy
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off when you arrive at this hotel. It has a slightly shabby narrow entrance with only a small sign outside which widens out when you enter. The staff are very friendly & the rooms comfortable & well equipped with good bathroom facilities. Although there are TVs in the rooms they don't seem to have any English language programmes, but who goes to Venice to watch TV? The superior rooms have a small balcony & face out onto the lagoon whilst the standard rooms face in on a small private courtyard. There are three floors all serviced by a lift & the hotel is five minutes walk from Arsenale waterbus terminal & is close to the Piazza San Marco & most of the other main attractions. Breakfast is adequate although served in a small room on the first floor with only four tables. There are pleny of shops, bars & restaurants nearby with the prices getting cheaper if you move away from the main tourist routes. This is an excellent value for money hotel which I would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: lizzy094
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous weekend in Venice. We booked into the small Tribute to Music Hotel, right on the lagoon frontage, just a few steps from St Marks Square. On arrival we were offered to upgrade to their suite in their b&b just a little further along on the front. We were given total usage of their b&b suite, which included two large double bedrooms and a lounge area. A lady arrived on time each morning to prepare breakfast in the self contained kitchen area. The whole suite was very clean and well presented. Best of all was the superb view right across the whole vista of the lagoon - from the lido in one direction right across the bay to St Marks Square in the other direction. Perfect spot for watching the world go by. Staff all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Carnevale!”
Reviews.Author: Byron'sGirl
Reviews.Content: Very pleased after spending three nights in this hotel. It was clean and the staff was really awesome. One of the clerks even tried to help me adjust a rented costume. The location is on the Grand Canal, close to vaporetto stops and easy walking distance to St. Mark's Square. We were served a nice breakfast every morning -- very satisfying before beginning busy days. Our room was overlooking a courtyard in the back but I got a peek at the rooms in front and the view was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: trellybear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great budget option. Location is great, right next to a water taxi stop and only a short walk to St Marcus Square. Lovely and quiet with traditionally decorated rooms. Comfy sleep and typical continental breakfast which we were perfectly happy with. Staff are lovely, so happy to help and with great English, overall would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great views and location”
Reviews.Author: zzzzzz___tt
Reviews.Content: A rather old hotel, a little rustic but definately in good condition. We stayed in 2 rooms and both were facing the water...so it was beautiful. Staff were great and spoke good english. Location was great and convenient to the river boats (to the train station and to Murano island if you would like to visit the glass factories). The only improvement would be the toiletries provided. They only had small bars of soap and shampoo cam in a hard to open plastic packet (rather than bottles you expect for a hotel of this standard).

Reviews.Title: “Magic”
Reviews.Author: InesGrandi
Reviews.Content: Magic, that's our stay in this small beautiful Garni in Venice. The room (for 3) was perfect big enough, clean, well furnished and with the view on the laguna! The personnel was friendly and prepared. The only bad remark is for the breakfast: needs to be improved, the quality was not sufficient

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jv_lisboa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, 100 meters away from boats to the train station / airport (Arsenal station) and very close to St. Marcus Square. Don't expect much luxury, but if you look for comfort, very nice staff at a decent price this the ideal base to explore the city walking and by public transport. Two additional comments: try to get a room with a lagoon view. We asked for it and we got a fantastic room with a balcony facing the lagoon. Wonderful! Second, it has Wi-fi but at a price (5â‚¬/day). I really think they could improve that, for me it is an increasingly basic thing hotels should offer, particularly in tourist-oriented locations. All in all, very good stay, I will certainly bet back there if I return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hjea
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this hotel with our adolescent children. Fantastic room in the quad room with amazing view of lagoon, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, kitchenette and small living room! Good breakfast. Excellent staff - extremely helpful. Great location - near San Marco piazza restaurants and vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “great view...tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon. The location was great, easy to find, which you can't always say for Venice! The staff was friendly, although the second night the guy at the front desk didn't really have restaurant recommendations (basic skill for a hotel clerk...) Our room was very skinny-about a foot between the end of the bed and the wall, although the bathroom was large, clean and modern, with amazing lagoon views from the shower!. The electrical outlet was hanging off the wall, which made me a bit nervous, and although the decor was very dated, the view from our Juliet balcony was amazing and made me feel like a rockstar. The breakfast was great, lots of options with great service. We took advantage of the boat ride to Murano and went to the glass factory, which was a neat experience (just a tip...the glass in the factory is 3 times the price of the shops in the rest of the town) The location and view was fantastic, and as long as you aren't a large person, the room will suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excelent view”
Reviews.Author: Inescarlos
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in an excelent location and with gorgeous views. Our room was beautifull, large and with view. The breakfast room was very small and with few options. The hotel is near Piazza San Marco and many good restaurants and easy acess to vaporetto. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravelworld
Reviews.Content: Great views from our room (make sure you book one with view onto the lagoon.) It's close walking distance to San Marco. It's also near the Aresenale vaporetto stop (for trips to/from airport or around the city, or to Murano etc.) The room was simple but fine; likewise the breakfast. But most of the day you're walking around anyways. I think this was great value. If you like to "trade up" to a nice hotel with similarly good views, try Hotel Bucintoro, where we stayed as well for a few nights. It's on the other side of the Arsenale stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near st marks square”
Reviews.Author: sandeep70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for two nights. The receptionist was very friendly and helped us plan our two days very well. The furniture is old style but the rooms were good in size. We got down at St marks square terminal and had to walk two blocks to the hotel. If you are coming by the ferry you need to get down at a different terminal, though I don't remember the name . The lady at breakfast table could not speak english and it was with a iPhone translator that I could ask for a fork :) . My kids liked the rooms. The view from the window was good. It was overlooking the street and water view. There are a lot of restaurants nearby. The wi-fi worked.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faith N
Reviews.Content: Okay, you have to keep in mind that this is really a 3-star hotel. On that basis, it is very good. It is extremely well located - easy access to all the sights but not in the 'thick' of things. It is easy to find directly on the Riva Degli Schaivoni but note that there is not a huge hotel banner type sign - the entrance is rather unassuming. The rooms are actually really large and everything was clean. A 'homey' atmosphere. We had a very good stay. The only real downside was the price - very costly at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: Our family of three shared a room facing the lagoon - adequate space and fabulous view. Location is ideal: out of the door, turn right for a few minutes walk to St Mark's, turn left for a quiet promenade to seafront parks & restaurants in residential areas. Water bus and airport link stops a few metres away. Staff extremely helpful, and breakfast lovely with variety and as much as we could eat served by charming staff. Clean, intriguing and a hidden gem. Wifi fine too. Would stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “eh...”
Reviews.Author: navypop
Reviews.Content: unsurprisingly, not much value for the money; pluses included location and multilingual, helpful staff; negatives included small rooms, meager breakfast, and price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingal8784
Reviews.Content: I stayed if Venice for 3 nights and this hotel was absolutely perfect. It wasn't on the canal but it had a laggon view that was perfection.The front desk area is a little small but the rooms were clean and spacious. The price I thought was very reasonable and we were close to San Marco Square but far enough away that I didn't find it too loud to sleep or nap. This hotel I would stay at again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: CristiLeon
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this charming hotel, while exploring Venice. We felt just like being at someone's home, sleeping in the guest room. Full of personality and lovely vintage details (including bathroom fittings), this house is right on the waterfront and minutes from Piazza San Marco. Many restaurants and shops around, still far enough from the crowded and noisy areas so you can get a good sleep. Very clean and with all the modern facilities. The stuff was helpful and nice. Very comfortable stay, and so much more interesting than a regular hotel. If you book in advance, I guess you could get a good price for the fabulous room facing the Great Lagoon and the neraby islands.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel filled with character and delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: lauraelkha
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to Venice specifically for the 2011 Venice Biennale, and for those of you considering doing the same the hotel is in perfect proximity to both Arsenale and Giardini areas - a lovely walk to both main areas that will also take you past many of the installations that pop up in smaller buildings (if you can hunt down Chiharu Shiota's installation at Gervasuti Foundation). The room we stayed in on the second floor was full of charm with a very large and immaculately clean bathroom. It was also exceptionally quiet despite having windows that faced onto the Grand Canal and being opposite the breakfast room. Staff were exceptional, from the delightful front desk staff that had great recommendations for a 'non touristy' dinner (very necessary when in Venice...), to the warm and friendly woman who served us in the breakfast room.We were traveling for a number of months throughout Europe for work and pleasure and I have to say that the staff at A Tribute to Music were some of the best we've come across anywhere. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and would like to thank the staff for providing such a wonderful experience. We'll be back for the next Biennale!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: holiday-hopeful2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in July and could not have been happier. The young women at the reception desk were so friendly and welcoming. On our way up to our room, we were told "we have a surprise for you." I was thinking a bottle of wine perhaps? They had upgraded us from a double room lagoon view, to the apartment on the top floor where we had our own little balcony from which we could watch the world go by while enjoying a glass of prosecco. Even without the upgrade, we would have had the breathtaking view of the lagoon, just a few minutes walk from St Mark's. The hotel is in a great position, is comfortable, the staff are lovely, as well as offer a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it & recommend it 100%”
Reviews.Author: JoieAV
Reviews.Content: our family loved this hotel & will come back here again. the staff are very friendly & courteous. the staff are very prompt in corresponding through email about accommodating our requests. the room & bathroom is large & clean. our room have a magnificent view of St Mark's basin. location is perfect, about 5 minutes walk to St Mark's square. 15 minutes walk to Rialto Bridge. free water taxi to murano island. breakfast is enough to start your day. luggage deposit is conveniently available if you're too early to check in or late check out. we thank the staff & management of this hotel for making our stay in Venice both comfortable & memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd stay here and even better than the first time!”
Reviews.Author: JockScotlandUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in June 2011. We picked this hotel based on our previous stay with them in 2010. The location is perfect - a few minutes walk from St Mark's Square, overlooking the lagoon, right next to Alilaguna Arsenale waterbus stop, a huge selection of restaurants on the doorstep. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a room with a rooftop terrace. The terrace was fantastic for catching the sun throughout the day, great view, and it's just the best place for the generous continental breakfast (brought to the room every morning!). Comfortable bed, and no noise from the street during the night, despite the number of tourists passing through the day. Very clean, high standards throughout. The staff are incredibly helpful. My Italian is terrible. Fortunately, Martina and Lisa (and the other staff we met) spoke excellent English (Lisa spent some time at St Andrews University in Scotland during her studies) and were there to help with translation of Italian words and phrases, recommendations for eating places, transport timetables and any other queries we had. As a recommendation for a good meal at a reasonable price and great friendly service, try the Al Vecio Portal. Turn left as you exit the hotel front entrance, then take the second left turn. The restaurant is about 100 metres or so on your right - the garden at the rear is a haven away from the hustle and bustle. The food quality is great, prices are far better than the places on the main street. We had dinner there several times during our stay. We couldn't find anything to fault during our stay. We know we'll return to Venice - it's such a beautiful place - and the Tribute To Music will be our choice of hotel once again. It's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Dont look around - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DorchesterBev
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view of Venice and the comings and goings of those unfortunate enough to not be staying here. Our room was beautiful (just like the picture), comfortable and very clean. The staff could not be faulted and made great suggestions as to where to eat locally or further afield. We had a huge breakfast delivered to our room each morning, any time we wanted and had an early breakfast in the breakfast room when we had to leave on our last day. I cannot recommend this hotel enough and would stay there again at a moments notice.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: merts65
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to find a better example of a hotel of this type and value. Room, view, breakfast, reception: all BELLISSIMO.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant! Great friendly staff, fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: fowlergirl24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first two nights of our honeymoon and were delighted by the stunning location and beautiful views. The staff, particularly manager, Martina, were so friendly, accommodating and helpful- we had booked a lovely room and when they heard we were on our honeymoon they upgraded us a to beautiful room on the top floor with a terrace overlooking the lagoon. It was a really wonderful experience for us and we were so pleased that the people here made us feel so welcome and special. They also gave us lots of helpful information on where to go and the best places to eat. They contributed greatly to giving us a very memorable holiday. I could not recommend them enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Staff extremely helpful and charming”
Reviews.Author: ginahall28
Reviews.Content: Went to Venice for a long weekend with my husband and stayed here - cannot think of anything negative to say about it. Perfect location (overlooking the lagoon) and only a three minute walk to St Marks Square. Staff were extremely helpful and charming - excellent service. Try to request one of the rooms at the top with a balcony. We had breakfast on the balcony every morning and it was lovely - watching the cruise ships and boats come into port. Fantastic !!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kiziltay
Reviews.Content: Small but very nice hotel. The location is excellent and the welcome is very friendly and attentive in this small Venietian hotel. wehad a room with lagoon view and it was wortwhile. Sure it will be in our list whenver we plan another visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A Tribute to 'A Tribute do Music Residenza'”
Reviews.Author: Marygla
Reviews.Content: My room was named after "Elvis Presley"and I do think you ought to stay at this hotel when you visit Venice. Yet, don't pack" blue suede shoes".Rain shoes and sneakers are of a much greater use.The staff is and are (with all the grammar nuances attachec to it) very nice and efficient. Breakfast is great especially because once again,n a efficient and sympathetic lady from Moldovia (during my stay) adds sympathy to the other ingredients on display. Location is superb.Near vaporetto and S.Marco. Have a great sunny stay in expensive and expansive Venice at a fair price. Manuella, Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: BeingUs
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, we got the room facing the best view ever! Very close to the waterbus stops, walking distance to St. Mark's. We even got a complimentary trip to Murano and a guided tour of a glass factory. Theres also a wonderful restaurant just below the hotel, to the right when you leave the hotel, we had dinner every night there, lovely service and fresh food. The rooms are done up in old Venetian decor, a bit old here and there, but it adds to the 'feel' of the place. And the room was very spacious with a balcony, compared to the tiny room in Rome, this was palace-like! Staff were also very friendly and sweet. Would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “the best choice you can make!”
Reviews.Author: hcroatia
Reviews.Content: If going to Venice, bring lots and lots of money since the price are off the chart, but if you choose to stay at hotel Tribute to Music than you made a good deal. Don't be scared if you can find the name of the hotel on the building, you can see the number of the house and although you wouldn't say at first that it is a hotel, when you enter inside the welcoming of the receptionist will surely assure you that you are in the wright place. Everything was perfect, rooms are so so nice and pleasant, hotel is so clean that you can eat from a floor (I run a hotel myself so I would know), and all the staff will do everything to make sure that you are glad to have decided that this is your stop while in Venice. Everything you need to see is 2-3 minutes of walk away, if it is a nice day do what we did, walk along the entire Grand Canal, it is a wonderful experience. We will surely be coming back! One tip about the parking in Venice, it is better to come by train, plane or something similar since the price of the parking on Piazzale Roma is 30 euro per day, it is acceptable when you are there for a day or two, but 7 days or more, well, you can do your own calculation...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great people, great view, great room, great value”
Reviews.Author: Kites1974
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Venice and this hotel really added to the experience. I think probably the best thing about this hotel is its location. We had a double superior room with an amazing view of the lagoon that you just couldn't take your eyes off. Its ever changing as the light changes throughout the day and is constantly buzzing with activity. The other great thing about the location is that it is perfectly situated minutes from the centre of activity that is San Marco and a couple of minutes the other way has you in a quieter part of town with nice restaurants and bars (via garibaldi). Our room was massive and we were genuinely surprised as most of the rooms we had seen in venice hotels were boxes. The only other thing to say about this place is the people, genuinely friendly and really really helpful. What I would say to anyone visiting Venice is listen to the locals and their recommendations, it is the only way to navigate your way through the millions of restaurants with varying degrees of quality and price. The People working in the hotel recommended a few for us and they were the best meals we had the whole time. In short I couldn't fault this place, perfect location for the perfect city break!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, perfect location. clean. friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KayClarkson
Reviews.Content: We were travelling on our honeymoon and stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and were very impressed. the hotel room was slightly smaller than would of liked but was not a problem decor was nice in room and hotel. hotel was very clean everywere. staff on reception were very friendly and helpful at all times, breakfast was good staff friendly bu only spoke italian but wasnt an issue many options to choose from. Main plus was the location of this hotel it was very close to two water bus stops to get to the airport and was a 5 minute walkk from st marks square which was the main attraction to see in Venice, everything was walking distance. overall were very impressed with this hotel and would definately stay again or recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MelKaty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a few "blocks" from St. Mark's square. We liked this hotel a lot. Our room was overlooking the lagoon with 2 windows. I'm used to American standard hotels but after staying in hotels all over Italy, this was a very pleasant stay (although for only 1 short night). The lady up front was very pleasant and helpful. Give yourself plenty of time to check out if you have somewhere to be. There is only one person up front and there can be a wait. Although it seemed to be in a busy spot with lots of touristy shacks (not a fan, but it wasn't horrible), there wasn't any noise. That may have been because we were there during the day. We have no complaints at all about this hotel. I didn't get many pictures of the hotel or views but here's what i have.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with a view and location that can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: starrieyed
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room on the second floor (I think it was called the Vivaldi room). The room was spacious for Venice standards. The beds were comfortable. There was a gorgeous view of the Venice lagoon out the window. We consider ourselves budget travelers and we could not believe that we could afford a room with such an amazing view. We liked to just sit and take in the view in the mornings before the streets start to fill with tourists and peddlers. Also, the bathroom was very clean and luxurious for our standards. The front desk was very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. On the day we were leaving, we checked out and headed for the water bus (vapretto). Because it was rush hour, there was a massive crowd of Venetian residents trying to cram themselves onto what was already a crowded vehicle. We got separated from the people we were traveling with and one member of our group ended up onto the water bus and the rest of us didn't. The canals of Venice doesn't lend itself very well to chasing after the water bus, so we were panicking. We ended up going back to the hotel and we were let back into the room we already checked out of to make an international phone call(for free) to the group member we lost, so in the end we were able to make arrangements to meet back at the hotel. We were endlessly grateful to the hotel for lending us a hand in this situation. Two tips I wanted to share: - When you leave the hotel, turning right will lead you to all the touristy areas with the typical tourist-trap restaurants. Turning left will lead you to a more residential area of restaurants with lower prices and better food. - Getting to the hotel from the train station using the water bus was easy. We took Line 1 and got a boat tour of Venice along the way. However, if you need to catch a train leaving Venice for which you have a reservation, you want to leave 90 min to a hour to be safe. In our case, we were meticulous in checking the vapretto schedules the night before and figured we were catching one that would get us to the train station on time. What actually happened was that if the fog is too heavy, the vapretto won't come at all with no notice. By the time we figured this out, it was too late. Also, a water taxi is more reliable (there is a stand right outside the hotel). We inquired about one and it seemed like there is alot of negotiation room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “loved this little hotel, its fabulous”
Reviews.Author: niamhy09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a few days and really enjoyed it, staff were lovely rooms really comfortable, we actually got engaged while looking out over the canal on the balcony as it was just so beautiful, would recomened it to any one going to venice as its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little boutique hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kris69Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Venice is breathtaking and it was enhanced by the hotel. We had one of the rooms on the second floor which had a wonderful view of the canal (slightly noisy but mostly serene), ther was a view even from the bathroom! The room itself was decent sized for Venice and the bathroom was quite romy and clean. We loved the one night we spent there with attentive staff and a great location to walk around and discover venice. The water taxi (vaporeto) stop is close and convinient even from the Airport. would recommend this hotel to first timers like me given the value for money, proximity to sights, shops, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms vary immensely”
Reviews.Author: RosaBrighton
Reviews.Content: Looked forward to staying having read the reviews, however it is apparent that rooms vary immensely. Our room was very small and there was damp on the ceiling and the bathroom was just not clean. Breakfast very disappointing - we initially had to queue to get a table - and were served hard unfresh croissants and juice that was not fresh.

Reviews.Title: “simply breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Pitagoras69
Reviews.Content: it was our engagement trip to Venice. Hotel gave us their best appartment with a terrace overlooking the lagoon (stunning view) what's more: our room was clean and cosy, with large bathroom and even larger bed (if you know what I mean ;) approx. 500m from Piazza San Marco - that tells everything I believe

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view and more than friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AbiWar
Reviews.Content: We had a room with the view and it was absolutely breathtaking. Made us smile every morning we woke up. Also hotel staff (thanks ladies!) was excellent - always there, always ready to help you, always smiling. Room was small but very cosy ,beautifully designed (I liked hand painted furnitures) with a big, comfortable bed. Surprisingly big (comparing to the size of the room) bathroom with a big window. In short words : if we were to come back to Venice - we would visit this place once more.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable place, Whenever I go back to Venice, this is my hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MLaa
Reviews.Content: The location is great, difficult to imagine any better. Service was good and rooms were excellent and really beautiful! What else can you execpt?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: purpletravller
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in central location. We stayed in one of the superior rooms which is on the top floor (in an attic conversion), large room, very clean and with its own little "kitchen" area. There was also the added bonus of a little balcony which overlooked the lagoon - couldnt fault it! Lovely staff, very helpful and suggested pleasant restaurants. Good breakfast too but dinning area is a little small (cosy!), that said, if all of the tables were taken the staff offered to make up a tray for you to take back to your room - not many places offer that sort of service!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable and magic, like Venice...”
Reviews.Author: deboravh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! Cozy hotel (in a 19th century house), great staff (specially Lisa, from the front desk, who explained everything about the city, where to eat good food, best atractions etc...), good breakfast, great location (about two blocks from San Marco Square), internet for a reasonable price (5 euro for 24h), very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: booandkitty
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at A tribute to music from 2nd Feb to 6th Feb with a booking from lastminute.com. We chose this hotel due to its location and the free offers of a city map, entry to a casio and, most important, a trip to the glass factories on Murano. We flew with easyjet direct to Marco Polo airport and took a vaporetto (water bus) from the airport to Venice. Please see to hotel website for details. The water bus took a route past some smaller islands, with a stop at the Lido before going around the Castello district for the Arsenal stop which took about 1 hour. The hotel was easy to find despite the fact it was dark when we arrived. We received a warm welcome, our free map and a quick briefing on breakfast arrangements and were shown straight to our room on the first floor. We had booked a double room with a Lagoon view and it was perfect. The view was fantastic, the room clean and quite spacious with Tea/Coffee making facilities. The bathroom too was clean and spacious with a bath/shower, toiletries and a large heated towel rack. The Continential Breakfast was served in a room at the end of the corridor and although it is substantial, it can be alittle repetative after a few days as it is the same fair everyday. On our first day in Venice, we purchased a Chorus pass from the tourist office in the left hand corner of San Marco Piazza as look down the square with the Basilica behind you. The Hotel is only a 5min Walk from this amazing site. The Chorus pass allows you to visit 16 of the best Churches in Venice and is a great way to explore this beautiful city. Best advice would be to start as early as possible if you wish to get your monies worth and a map is essential to avoid getting badly lost and to plot a route to the churches that interest you most. We managed to vist 6 in total, one of which was closed so please also check opening times if it is a church you really want to go in. We took over 200 photos of Venice just walking around finding these churches. On our second day, we did 3 excursions with a company called Venice Events ( 1827 San Marco, 30124 - Venice, Italy) which was a guided tour of the Basilica di San Marco including the Pala d' Oro, a guided tour of the Palazzo Ducale including the prison over the Bridge of Sighs and a gondola ride around some of the lesser known canals and waterways. On our last day, we did our fourth excursion with Venice Events which was a guided tour of the Grand canal in a water taxi with a real Venitian resident, and our trip to the glass factories on Murano which was organised by the hotel. Murano was the one place that my girl really wanted to visit and it was great to see the glass blowers making the piecies of glass and to feel the heat of the furnaces. General Stuff There are many restaurants and cafes in Venice to choose from with generally good food and good friendly service. Our fav restaurant was a Trattitore in the first alleyway on the right as you leave the hotel towards San Marco Square. Be aware of the restaurants that the hotel recommends, particularly by Jack. The couple who went with us to Murano did not like the food or service and the restaurant he recommended and other trip advisors have mentioned this as well. Look out for the ' hidden charges' on restaurant menus especially the cover charges. We only had one problem with a bill at a restaurant who had a four hour happy hour with 50% off your bill. Extra drinks and food we did not have appeared on it and when questioned about this, with out even saying ok I'll check with the waiter, it was removed from the bill without an apology or a smile which leads me to think they do this quite regularly hence no argument about changing the bill. Generally speaking, there are quite a few 'hidden charges' on things e.g. extra charges in the Basilica to view the Pala d' Oro or the free trip to Murano by the hotel, it is only one way! You have to make your own way back. Be aware. Overall, Venice is a great city, clean and very safe. We had a great time and will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: sarahindublin
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to the far side of the world and back again, I have experienced hotels of all standards. I wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel. I had heard that hotel rooms in Venice were very small and very expensive, especially if you were anywhere near Piazza San Marco. I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. The room was large and well proportioned, The bathroom was a good size too. The room was lovely and warm, which was great, because you don't go to Venice in January for the warm weather! The service in A Tribute to Music was some of the best I've seen in any hotel I've stayed in. We arrived earlier than the check in time, so Martina on the check in desk took our bags until check in time. This is standard in most hotels, but she then recommended somewhere for us to go for lunch. After a 7am flight from Dublin, we were ready for a decent bite to eat. It was a perfect spot to go. A local cafe that served the best sandwiches. When we returned to check in, our bags were in our room and we got a tour of the hotel. Later that evening, we were ready to head out for dinner. We asked the guy on the desk (Jack) where he could suggest. We said that we would prefer somewhere off the beaten track where we could try somewhere that the locals would go, as opposed to the tourist trap places. He recommended a great place with the best seafood, Il Nuovo Galeon. Really decent wine list too! I've read a few reviews complaining about the standard of the breakfasts in this hotel. I found the breakfast to be everything that you would expect from a continental breakfast, We found that it set us up for the many miles that we were to walk each day around Venice. We didn't need lunch until late afternoon most days after having breakfast at 8am. The coffee was great too. I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough. The breakfast, the room, the views, but most importantly, the service. The staff in A Tribute to Music go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible. I will most certainly stay here when I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: btatravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early into Venice on an overnite train from Munich and were greeted warmly by the front desk. He stored our luggae until we could check in later and offered any advice and tips as we went for a walk around. The hotel is within very easy walking distance of all of Venice. Our room had a view of St. Mark's Basin that rivalled our Tuscany Hills views. The breakfast was not as strong as other hotels but still a great way to start a day. When we visit Venice again, we will book at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recomended!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeannine_myl
Reviews.Content: From Creece,Creta The location is amazing since you can walk esily to the st Marcus sq but also to less touristic sites such as the gardini.The vaporeto station is 1 min walk away which is very suitable.The view from the room was absolutely marvelous(even when I was taking a shower I had the laguna view in front of me.!!) We stayed at the penthouse in 2 rooms which were unified by a coridor which we also could use, so the space we had was hudge.We also had 2 beautifull (pretty large as well) balconies.The bathroom instalation looked new,bright and very clean .The kitchen facilities was fully equiped(even olive oil salt etc were provided).In general the room was very ambient and romantic and at the same time it felt like being at home.Although I have to mention that the old staircase and the low ceiling that leads to the room felt I bit scary at the begining. We found the breakfast really charming since it was in a small nice room and served by a very fine lady.Yoghurt,croissants,tosts,fruit salad,chesse and prosuito in very large quantities is more than a traveller can ask. The staff was very kind, friendly and smilly, although they recomended us restaurants that weren't much of our taste...Wireless internet was also provided. Venice is a ambient city and I think by staying to that hotel we felt tottaly in that cultural romantic and historical atmosphere.We spend there 4 beautifull unforgetable days and we can deffinetelly say that at our next trip to Venice we are going to book a room at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotl, fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: kathym84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at A Tribute to Music in Venice for 4 nights in September 09. The front of the hotel just looks like the front door to a house. (We later learnt that it is not just a hotel, but apartments as well). We arrived late at night and were met by a night receptionst, a very friendly young man who spoke perfect English. He took us to our room, explaining about the hotel facilities on the way. The room was lovely, clean and stylish. Our room was at the front of the hotel, the views were spectacular, the sight of massive cruise ships going past our window several times a day is something we will never forget. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast room was very small and the breakfast basic but more than adequate. It was interesting to hear the waitresses reel of the breakfast menu to guests who had no idea of what they were saying! Our advice is ask for your tea, coffee etc nd then just say 'Si' to everything else. The hotel is a couple of minutes walk from St Marks Square which is fantastic but does get very busy. The atmosphere in the square at night is not to be missed, with all the little orchestras playing outside the cafes The best part of this is the large square at the back of the main front square. Yes Venice is expensive, but most people ralise that before they travel. We found most people to be very friendly. We would definitely stay at A Tribute to Music again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but price of everything kinda spoiled it”
Reviews.Author: jace_2206
Reviews.Content: firstly let me say the room (203) was very nice it had a nice view and venice is a beautiful city very busy but still very nice . however the downside was the cost of everything it was honestley really ridicalous the cost of water and food (most of which was not very good and did not justify the price afterall the italians are meant to be good chefs but not in my experience) then there was the the unwelcome guests in the hotel room I have never seen an insect like it before it was like a centerpied with really long legs and it moved so fast there were three altogether and then the really pricey phone bill that we had at the end of our stay we had asked how much the room phone would cost at the beggining and were told not very much however when we got the bill it was for 50 euros for 1 hour of usage which is the most any hotel has ever charged us infact more than double any have charged us, i did feel a little cheated and ripped off with this. the staff were nice and maid was regular i always tip but wish i hadn't now after seeing the phone bill. back to the city it is really nice but again very very expensive so much so that it takes any romance out of the city and alot of the shop/resturaunt staff were rude and didnt seem to like people attempting to speak italian (it kinda feels that they just dont try any more because they know people will come in their thousnads anyway) if i had to give some advice it would be bring suncream it was very hot also whatever your budget is forget it and double even treble it if you can, you cannot eat out on budget like i said lovely city its just a shame about the cost of things and the locals and their attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Venezia at Your Window!”
Reviews.Author: travelincanuck_9
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my wife and I were only able to stay at this charming little hotel for one night as we were boarding a cruise the next day. If you're looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in the San Marcos area but still want comfort and modernity, this is for you. All the rooms are named after well known musical artists. Classical on the first, jazz on the second, and rock-pop on the third. We stayed in the Rolling Stones room and had a beautiful view of the Grande Canal. This place is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, very friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: UK-family-traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with our 13 yr old daughter, all staying on one room - worked really well; drop dead view from the window of the lagoon, all the hustle and bustle of the vaporetto stops just below our window. 10 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. Staff couldn't be more helpful, lending me use of their computer, advising on places and so on. Only complaint is that breakfast is a bit thin - fruit juice and fruit salad were out of a tin and coffee was not as delicious as you'd expect. However, we've yet to find a great breakfast at an Italian hotel (cf. France for example), so maybe they are par for the course.

Reviews.Title: “pictures do not say a thousand words”
Reviews.Author: pinme
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is in a very poor decorated not air conditioned small crampted room , no fresh fruit, no eggs, poor choice of bread - They need some professional help! Rooms are quite small even though pictures seem larger. Bathrooms are quite old and need updating. Would be more interesting if hotel stated SM of each room reserved. very expensive for quality and level of sevice. The view of front rooms is great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for your Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lexie2028
Reviews.Content: We were all pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location is fantastic and our room overlooked St Mark's Basin. We took lots of pictures from our window! The staff were helpful and always friendly. The room was decorated in a Venetian style and very clean. I would recommend this hotel for anyone heading to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great views”
Reviews.Author: Aztec_and_Motley
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great value for money. The staff here are extremely friendly and helpful, and the views across the lagoon to San Giorgio are magnificent. You can walk along the waterfront to St Marks Square in a few minutes, past much more expensive and stuffy hotels offering very little more than this one. Or turn up the sidestreets into one of the nicest quarters of Venice. Our room was excellent and quite big, with great views. Cleaning was good, tea/coffee/minibar stuff useful. Television all in Italian but pointless anyway - who would go to Venice to watch TV? Breakfast is continental (not hot) and adequate. Tips - Get the vaporetto from the airport (Marco Polo) - it stops almost outside the door. Try to get a room with a lagoon view - the higher the floor the better. Don't be put off by the exterior (there's no sign, just a bell) - the interior is excellent. The staff love to help with information about transport, sight-seeing and eating out, and their recommendations are usually good, in a city where finding good places to eat is a nightmare. I can't understand why anyone would write a bad review of this hotel. In fact hardly anyone has except one person who was double-booked and housed elsewhere, and one person who said 'the windows have very old hardware on them ' - clearly missing the point of Venice entirely!

Reviews.Title: “What a room, what a view, WOW!”
Reviews.Author: marinablue
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate to be able to take a short holiday in Venice four or five times a year. Sometimes I stay at an old favourite like Ca Formenta or Villa Igea whilst other times I try somewhere new. More often than not some where new disappoints and I'd wished that I had stay at an old favourite instead. This certainly was not the case with A Tribute to Music which I now must add to my list of favourite places to stay. Because of the time of year I went I got a really good rate for my stay, but I did note that at other times it could be a tad expensive From the outside, the hotel looks very anominous; in fact you would not recognise it as one. The hotel reception area is very small and at first you may be a little disappointed, but just wait until you get into your room. All the rooms are named after musicians/composers and each floor represents a different style of music, such as Classical (e.g. Vivaldi), Blues and Jazz (e.g. Louis Armstrong) and Pop (e.g. Rolling Stones) although this is not reflected at all in the rooms' decoration, bathroom, fittings and furniture which are all high class Venetian in style, beautifully finished. I had the Miles Davies Room on the second floor. It was most definitely the best bedroom I have ever had in Venice, even beating the Villa Igea. Oh what joy to come in late in the afternoon after a hard day's sightseeing, fling open the two huge windows, sit on the bed and watch life go by on the Riva and all the activity, comings and goings of the boats as they off loaded or collected their little groups of tourists whilst eating a wonderful Italian ice cream purchased on the way back to the hotel. The view is lovely and you get both the sunrise and sunset effects on the buildings across to San Gorgio Maggiore, Guidecca with the Redentore Church and then back to the Salute at the junction of the Grand Canal and the Guidecca Canal. You almost don't want to be bothered to venture out of your room but sit there all day gazing at the view. I was really lucky with the weather this time and had wall to wall blue sky and sunshine (although a bit chilly) for all the 6 days I was in Venice, amazing for mid-March. And if you perchance to wake during the night, a look out of the window beguiles with a full moon( if you are lucky as I was) and its reflection rippling across the water of the Bacino from San Giorgio Maggiore. I guess you could be a bit disappointed with the breakfast room (looks like it was originally a smallish bedroom and bathroom converted into the breakfast room). Nevertheless breakfast which is served at your table has a certain charm and the waitresses (who also were the bedroom maids, I think) were very friendly and efficient. In your room, there is a small fridge containing bottled water, coke, couple of tins of beer which I think are complimentary - but check with Reception. As other reviewers have said, this hotel is very convenient for all the sites and for transport around Venice and to/from the airport. Staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are spotlessly clean. The bath had a handheld shower which was very powerful. In these credit crunch times beware that if you use the public loos in Venice the price is 1 euro 50 (i.e. Â£1.50), food in some restaurants is extremely poor value and quality. For a special day out and something different, I recommend taking the boat to Torcello (from the Riva , one an hour). You have to change at Burano but the change of boats is synchronised so you don't have to hang about for a connection. Go and look at the spectacular mosaics in the ancient church there and then, before leaving atmospheric and quiet Torcello, have a perfect lunch, with perfect service in lovely settings at a reasonable price at the Villa 600 Restaurant which faces more or less the small rustic Cipriani Hotel and Restaurant by the bridge leading to the Church (offshoot of the glitzy Cipriani in Venice). Torcello seems miles away from the tourist hustle and bustle of Venice. A place to chill out. You can then get the litle shuttle boat back to Burano and spend the rest of the afternoon exploring this old fishing islands with the colourful houses.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: meeEngland
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking for a suitable hotel for our visit to Venice and I could not have chosen a better hotel. My husband and I took my father-in-law for his birthday treat to Venice 22-23 March 2009. We had visited Venice before but he hadn't. We knew roughly where we wanted to go: a short walking distance from a Vaparetto stop, near the main sites, a good view of Venice and a hotel that wasn't too big. We got all that and more in 'A Tribute to Music' hotel. It is about 2 mins walk from the Arsenale stop and 5 mins from the S Marco Zaccaria stop so a perfect location. I had booked two rooms with a lagoon view and what a view we got! It must be one of the best views in Venice as in front of us was the island of San Giorgio Maggiore and the lagoon of San Marco. The rooms were larger than I expected, beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. The bathroom felt new and extremely clean and everything worked well. We had a warm welcome straight away as we walked into my father-in-law's room - a bottle of the best Prosecco wine with three glasses waiting for us to celebrate his birthday (it was after all his 90th)!! Thank you so much for that, in case we didn't express that enough during our visit. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Martina, the young lady at the reception, went out of her way to make us welcome (she even made us a cup of tea when we went to collect our luggage which we could leave all day in the hotel after checking out). She speaks excellent English and French. The breakfast was good , just as 'reilina' below describes. My father-in-law didn't want to leave the hotel, he thought it was perfect and everything possible was thought of. It obviously made me happy too as I had to book the hotel for us amongst so many in Venice. We can recommend this hotel to anybody who wants a friendly and clean hotel with a superb location and view. Look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience.”
Reviews.Author: reilina
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have visited Venice before and never found a hotel or guesthouse like this one. When I had only a weekend to show a friend everything she wanted to see in Venice, we decided we needed a very nice, relaxing, centrally-located hotel to facilitate our need to get a lot done in two very short days. Residenza A Tribute to Music not only met, but exceeded our expectations, especially for the price. The rooms have definite style (See photos). We booked a less expensive courtyard room view since we'd be spending most of our time outside anyway, but the rooms with water views that we saw being cleaned looked superb, and were much larger than our already adequately sized room. Martina at the front desk welcomed us, gave us maps, directions, and showed us where to find a quick bite for lunch, and consistently just answered all our little questions throughout the weekend. She really made us feel like valued guests. The location of the hotel is not directly on San Marco, but a short 5 minute walk away. It is central enough that you do not have to wade through seas of tourists just to get to and from the hotel. Although it is not at all loud at night since the busier activity is up the road, it is located on the main street along the lagoon. This made two girls traveling alone feel much more comfortable, since unlike the smaller side streets of Venice, you will always see people out and about on your way home, so you do not have to be uneasy about returning late from a restaurant. Additionally, the hotel had someone at the desk 24 hours, and you had to ring to enter, day or night, and retrieve your key from them, and you had to unlock your floor in the elevator. The security was certainly extensive. Also, the breakfast was superb. The breads were fresh, the hot chocolate superb, and the offerings very extensive for an Italian breakfast (such as cold cuts and cheese, in addition to the breads, toasts, croissants, fruits, and cereals). The lady serving breakfast was very patient with our attempts at Italian and did not keep us waiting. Overall, I have no complaints about the Residenza A Tribute to Music. It is an oasis in a city full of less than remarkable and highly overpriced hotels. If you are looking for good local food and wine in an unpretentious restaurant, I recommend the Bistrot de Venise. It is about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel just north of Piazza San Marco, and definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at A Tribute To Music Hotel in Venice. Overall we had a great time and loved the hotel. Location is fantastic, it's right on the waterfront about 2 minute walk from Arsenal water taxi station and a 5 minute walk from St Marks Square. The hotel is not that easy to find, there is no large sign outside naming the hotel, however there is a small plaque to the left of the main door. The staff were very helpful and friendly, on arrival we were given a map and the staff member showed us where to find all the main sights. He then personally showed us to our room. We were given a small room at the back of the hotel, however we had paid a cheaper rate. I know most of the other rooms are fairly large. Room was spotless and had all the facilities we needed. Overall an excellent hotel with very helpful and friendly staff in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasures”
Reviews.Author: Chargirl
Reviews.Content: Three ladies traveling together - I was in charge of booking hotel and discovered this jewel. Steps (well more than a few and less than two many) from the Water Taxi. Right on the waterfront, amongst the shops - a hidden doorway, a door bell - and we entered into another century of music tributes through the times. Family owned and operated, we were warmly greeted and so pleased with the ambiance. Only 12 rooms - ours (the Madonna) was a large quad (they upgraded us without request) - high ceilings, beautiful furnishings and a view out over the port and the water front. Clean & fresh stood out in every part from the bathroom to the small breakfast room. Martina Fossato and her Mother was helpful from the moment we booked and throughout our stay, with helpful hints on great restaurants. Included in the reasonable cost - was a private tour of Murano - simply put an incredible showcase of beautiful glass art. After that tour - we returned to admire all the many beautiful Murano vases, lamps, that decorated the public areas of the town house. Without question - on any return trips and for my friends who like the small family type residences....this will absolutely be my very first choice and recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor!”
Reviews.Author: Chris177
Reviews.Content: For our first ever trip to Venice, we booked a "Double Superior room with lagoon view, breakfast included" for 3 nights at "A Tribute to Music" directly from the hotel web-site, anticipating experiencing all the 'luxurious' features promised therein. The reality proved to be somewhat different. Arriving at the hotel at 6 p.m on Sunday evening, we were initially told that we could have the option of a suite at the same price as the room that we had booked. When we queried the details and it transpired that the accommodation was in a building some distance away, we stated our wish to remain in the hotel with the lagoon-view room that we had reserved. We were then told that no such room was available. Given the late hour, the distance we had travelled and the unknown city, we felt that we had no option but to reluctantly accept the situation. We were then introduced to Brenda, who we were told would prepare our breakfast in the morning. Subsequently, we were led across a bridge and along the canal-side to an apartment (described on our bill as "B and B La Corte dei Doge"). A section of this apartment formed our accommodation, the other rooms being locked. We approached the accommodation from the street-entrance by a somewhat dingy narrow staircase, and entered from the staircase by a door that apparently didn't lock. We did have a key to turn in our room and were told that we shouldn't be concerned as 'Venice is a safe city' and from the hallway, we had a telephone link with the hotel. We were shown the kitchen where breakfast would be served and asked to say there and then what time we wanted breakfast, and on deciding on 9 a.m we were told that Brenda would arrive at 8.30am to cook for us. Next morning, there was no sign of Brenda, but at 9 a.m a young woman appeared with a carrier bag and asked us to wait. Her preparations were complete within five minutes. Breakfast comprised cereal (just one type, no choice), a glass of fruit juice apiece (again, no choice), a few far-from-fresh rolls and croissants, small pots of yoghurt, a few small foil wrapped sections of cheese, tinned fruit salad and a plate containing slices of cold meat. This was accompanied by a cup of instant coffee each (obviously a cheap brand labelled 'coffee with cereal') and no option of a refill. As we ate, the young lady hovered about, which didn't exactly encourage us to linger over our food, and when we finished, she promptly cleared away and locked up after us. On each subsequent day, the same plate of meat and bowl of fruit salad were brought out, the rolls were replenished but were still not fresh. All in all, breakfast was reminiscent of a cheap backpacker's hostel and nothing like the 3-star experience shown on the web-site. Our room room was clean, with quite spacious en-suite facilities, a good view over the waterfront and the lagoon and a large comfortable bed, but we encountered a number of practical problems. Twice in three days the toilet in our en-suite bathroom failed to flush. On the first occasion, on the Monday evening, a call to reception elicited the initial response that it wouldn't be possible to get someone to look at it until tomorrow! Persistence finally got "the technician" to call within ten minutes. Response was rather quicker when we complained about the same problem a day later. In addition, the screws in door handles were loose, a matter of particular concern in our somewhat isolated position and, more worryingly, there appeared to be no fire precautions whatsoever - no instructions, no fire-escape, no smoke detectors, no fire extinguisher. We decided that nothing should cloud our experience of Venice and, after our initial complaint, we determined to make the most of our time there but we are in no doubt that we received a considerably inferior service to that offered at the time of booking. Many of the features for the room that we booked were simply not available, viz: "plentiful breakfast" telephone in the room desktop tea/coffee making facilities elevator 24-hour room service.

Reviews.Title: “It takes a lot to impress a seasoned traveller but...”
Reviews.Author: laptopLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here this week and as the title states it takes a lot to impress us. Venice is a city that is overrun with tourists all the time and to find a haven where they are still delighted to welcome you is so refreshing and at odds with most of the other experiences in Venice. The rooms are 'compact' which is not unusual for the location, are spotless and fully kitted out with all you might need in the way of comfort. The bathrooms are large and modern. The name made us wonder at first but donâ€™t be put off - each room is named and themed? after an artist from the history of music. Vivaldi to Madonna. Location is great as you walk out straight into the bustle of Venice and are a short walk from San Marco. The nicest thing by far was the welcome - nothing was too much trouble and lots of good insider advice was passed on. For someone who spends far too much time in hotels I have to say this was one of the finest in its class I have stayed in - ****

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lavenid
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel situated in an excellent location close to two vaporetta stops and a short walk from St.Marks Square.The room we stayed in had beautiful views over the lagoon and across to the island of San Giorgio Maggiore and its impressive church. The hotel staff were all welcoming,helpful and very friendly. Room was perfect ,very spacious, lovely and clean and the air conditioning was great. Bathroom also perfect very clean and fresh. Breakfast room was quite small, but we never had a problem getting a table. We had a most enjoyable four night stay and would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Making the most out of Venice”
Reviews.Author: kat_pap
Reviews.Content: We were on a family trip in Venice and stayed in this small hotel for just one day. We were welcome by the very helpful receptionist who made us feel at home and who supplied all the information we needed to make the most out of this short visit in Venice. Although check in was at 14.00pm and we were there at 11.00 am she made everything she could to get us into our room as quickly as possible. We were given the "Amadeus Mozart" quadruple room on the first floor. The view was magnificent and made worth the money we spent there. We had paid 220,00 euros for the family room but would pay it again in ordr to have the feeling that we were in the heart of Venice. However, you have to consider the noise from all the ferries and boats that pass by the harbour in front of the hotel , since the windows are not sounproof. That is , if you are easily disturbed and not an easy sleeper, you will have problems. Our room was spacious and very well maintained with lots of complimentary toiletries (even slippers). The brekfast was adequate (my sons really loved the hot chocolate and croissants) and the staff at the breakfast room very helpful, however I would prefer buffet breakfast instead of waiting for being served and having to ask for more coffee or nutella. During our check out the other receptionist (a man) was more than helpful offering to type some documents that I had lost .. All in all, I would definitely recomment Residenza la Musica to anyone who wishes to live in the heart of Venice (the hotel is very close to San Marco and within walking distance to most major sights of the city),who wishes to have access to vaporetto, and who wishes to have a quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: siteseer21
Reviews.Content: This place was a real treat after staying in may different hotels on our Europe vacation. First, the air conditioning was pretty great, HUGE rooms, great views if you like to people watch and watch the action on the street, while people catch boats and shop. Easy to catch water taxis and the taxi to the airport. So close to alot of sites. The staff is great and friendly!! Good Stay you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnita38
Reviews.Content: I would just would like to say that the hotel was great & very clean with the most helpful & delightful staff (Jack, Martina and Danny). Excellent location would definatly recommend to everyone to stay here as it is good value for money. Will definatly come back again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bertmeisterb
Reviews.Content: a tribute to the music was a wonderful hotel. we booked it at the train station when we are arrived at a very good rate. we didn't really know where we were going! but the hotel was beautiful and our room had a wonderful view. the bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom and had a view as well. the staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english. the hotel is quite close to a street with lots of restaurants which is (if possible in venice) a little less touristy and less expensive. i wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Purpleguardog
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - just 5 mins from St Marks - and right on the water front. Several little cafes just beside the hotel where you can get a welcome drink at the end of a long day! The hotel itself is small, very clean, great sized bedrooms, private bathrooms and a mini bar. Myself and my two 17 and 20 year olds had views looking over San Giorgio Maggiore and the Grand Canal! The front desk staff could not be more helpful, advice on where to eat to how much to pay for a Gondola. Nothing seemed too much trouble. Downside - no drawers in the bedrooms - but plenty of hanging space, breakfast room ridiculously small (but really didn't matter). I would recommend this hotel to anyone and should I find myself in Venice would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Attention to Customer Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: JoshHill114
Reviews.Content: Exceptional Customer Service! The friendly and most helpful staff at A Tribute to Music made our stay the most memorable in Venice yet! When faced with a challenge, they embraced the opportunity to demonstrate their true ability as a world class establishment. Friendly, committed and knowledgeable staff were the perfect compliment to the fine accommodations offered at A Tribute to Music. A Must Stay Location in the heart of San Marcos Square!

Reviews.Title: “what is the definition of 'superior'?”
Reviews.Author: Italyhotline
Reviews.Content: First the bad: I booked this hotel at a last minute discount site for 150 Euros per night. I booked the room based on Trip Advisor reviews. The room was a Superior Triple on the third floor (2nd per European standards). It was nicely furnished but lacked anything to distinguish it as superior, besides some cheap slippers. There was hardly any soap- two packets for three people for two nights- and it was very cheap. No other supplies in the bathroom. I travel a lot and I have to say that it is nice to get toiletries like a real container of shampoo or lotion instead of the plastic packets. The beds were covered with pretty damask covers but they were extremely perfumed and the smell bothered all three of us- we had a hard time falling asleep because of it and it was dusty. I had the covers removed the next day and then the overly perfumed smell went away. But when I saw the blanket on my bed was dirty- it had a stain on it which was, let's just say, rather disgusting, it became apparent that it had not been washed before we came to sleep in the room. The bathroom was alright. Some of the towels were nice, others very warn with strings hanging off of them. The tub looks nice but was extremely narrow (and I am petite) and difficult to even wash oneself in. There is no shower curtain or place to hand the shower so you have to take a tub. My parents (in their seventies) found this difficult and awkward. The windows have very old hardware on them and were hard to open and close and seemed as if they were about to fall apart. I had business to do on the trip and I chose the hotel partly because they had free wireless. Well, it didn't work and I spent several hours (time in venice majorly wasted) trying to make it work- part of which was with the help of my husband on the cell phone (money lost) since the man at the desk, though he tried to be helpful, was unable to ever get it going with either the wireless or a cable. I had just traveled to Seattle and around Washington state for three weeks using wireless everywhere with no problem. That was a major bummer. The good: The staff were friendly and helpful. They recommended a restaurant we didn't like for lunch the first day, but that was because the one they like to recommend was closed. They lent us an umbrella and a new guidebook to use during the whole time. The mattresses were very comfortable. The location was really great right on the water about a ten minute walk from St. Marks, with a water view of the boats. I didn't find it too loud but some people might. The price was reasonable for Venice. Regarding Restaurants: The 'Cleopatra' had tolerable food but not very good, and a terrible atmosphere with the TV blaring. They charged us a cover but never brought any bread. Il Vecio Portale was stupendous. Absolutely fantastic food and great service. The chef Pino was gracious, friendly and brought us wonderful food. The price was very reasonable and the meal made our time in Venice. They have a great menu, and there were many locals dining as well as some tourists. I had the ravioli stuffed with delicate white fish in a shrimp sauce- wonderful. Their caponata (eggplant) dish was excellent. We also ate at 'Giorgione' which was a good meal - I had an excellent Orata grilled fish. My father had excellent fried calamari with polenta. But they stuck us at a table which was butted up against the cooler and very uncomfortable and bad atmosphere in an otherwise delightful restaurant. I recommend the food but don't get stuck at that table in the back room.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, suprisingly quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancyandjamesh
Reviews.Content: While living in Austria last summer my fiance and I traveled with two of our friends on a last minute excursion to Venice. We booked one room (two King beds) at Residenza: A Tribute to Music. The hotel was actually much nicer than we imagined. The room was very spacious, albeit with the corny name "Madonna" (as in the pop star). The man who checked us in was very friendly and quite hilarious. The views were spectacular from the wall of windows. Service: Courteous. They even watched our luggage after we checked out so we could explore the city. Cleanliness: Very clean, and tidied the room once a day. Bathroom: Apart from the awkward step to reach the bathroom and the strange shower apparatus it was very nice, even luxurious. Overall lodging: Suprisingly nice and tasteful. The room also included breakfast, which was served in a too small location. It did include as much cereal, coffee, meats and cheeses, danishes, condiments, and juices as you wanted and served by friendly women. Expect a wait though if not an early-riser.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: limeewor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first weekend of Carnival and it was a perfect location for exploring. It did take us a little longer to find the hotel, there isn't a big sign out the front. However once found we were very happy. The rooms were warm (almost too warm, but ok once we worked out the heating), clean, and comfortable. The staff were extreamly friendly and very helpful. We had a really lovely stay. It may be worth taking a phrase book with you to breakfast if you are like us and understand little to no Italian, but the waitress was very freidly and we did end up eating something! We had a canal view room which was lovely as we had lovely views, however this did add some extra noise, what can you expect staying in such a central location! The hotel was easy to get to from the airport. We took a water bus to St Marks square and then walked to the hotel, took about 5mins. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: masaccio17
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Venice. It is a clean, comfortable and friendly place in a great location. The rooms were comfortable and the breakfasts were good. The staff at the hotel were both friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Good Value, Nice Staff.”
Reviews.Author: LindtGirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at A Tribute to Music in January 2008 in room 202. The room was not that big, but it was nicely decorated and very comfortable (and the bathroom was a good size). When the rooms were being cleaned we did notice that a lot of the other rooms seemed to be a fair bit bigger so you might be lucky and get one of those. We were on a very cheap rate so we didn't mind! The view from the room was wonderful though and you really feel you are in Venice when you can look out over the water and hear the boats. The only (very minor) unusual thing about the room was that the shower had no wall mounting and there was no shower curtain, but it wasn't an issue. The breakfast room is small as a few people have mentioned, but we didn't have a problem getting a table and there was plenty of food and good coffee. Plus the lady who worked there was really lovely and friendly. The best thing is the location - St Marks Square is 5 minutes walk away and the Vaporetto stop is pretty much in front of the hotel. It's very, very easy to get everywhere. There is also a little supermarket about 4 minutes walk behind the hotel on San Antonin if you want to stock up on snacks and drinks. And if you want a big supermarket there is a Coop on Fondamenta Nuove near the hospital (closest cross street is Calle de la Cappuccine). it was about 10-15 minutes walk away from the hotel. We really liked this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: holidayauckland
Reviews.Content: We had just finished our cruise in Venice we were booked into Tribute for Music. At first our water taxi could not find the hotel new to the job we arrived to find our room not ready but the staff were fantasic organising our bags so we could go and explore this beautiful city. We arrived back to find our bags had been placed in a room on the 1st floor the room was large exceptionaly clean and very tastefully decorated with wonderful views. The cute breakfast corner was lovely with excellent service. We could not find any faults with this Hotel and this made our stay in Venice have wonderful memories. The morning of our departure the hotel staff helped us with our bags to the water Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lpmch
Reviews.Content: Great views acoss the water and and clean well furnished rooms combine to make this an enjoyable small hotel to stay. The rooms at the front look out over the lagoon and the quayside- which has the downside of making it noisy from early morning as the hordes of tourists pass by from the cruise ships-- but its worth putting up with the noise for the view from bed. The two small problems are the fact that the only shower fitting is in the bath not fitted above so you can't stand and shower, and the very cramped breakfast room- which actually makes breakfast a stressful event even though the beakfast is very acceptable. The price is in keeping with the rest of Venice- expensive by comparison to anywhere else in Europe. We were made to feel very welcome, and the hotel is well maintained. All in all a pleasant and romantic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: katejones5
Reviews.Content: We had a great time exploring Venice in February. The hotel was delightful and the service was great. We chose a room overlooking the lagoon and loved waking up to that beautiful sight. The room was lavishly decorated and felt like a little bit of luxury on a small budget. Nowhere is too far on foot and there are 2 convenient water bus stops. We would definetly recommend this hotel to explore Venice and would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Axe
Reviews.Content: This B&B is in an excellent location with views over the San Marco basin (ask for a room with a view, Room 103 has a balcony). The staff are very helpful and friendly here! It's within easy walking distance to most attractions, and very close to a water bus stop. The wireless internet is abit pricey (Eu 3 for 15 min), but there is an internet cafe down the street for Eu 4.50 for 30 min. The front desk is manned 24 hrs. Air-conditioning works well. The rooms are clean and well-kept, furnished in period style. This place is excellent value for Venice (July Eu 155 for 4 people). The included breakfast is served in a small breakfast room, with a seating maximum of 16. You will probably have to wait for a spot, so get there early if you have reservations for a museum first thing in the morning. Boat noise might keep you awake, but generally, the air-con drowned out most noise from the street. There wasn't a shower stall here, just a bathtub with a hand shower. We really enjoyed our time here. We were here for Redentore, and had a stunning view of the fireworks from our room.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful little gem”
Reviews.Author: goldfinger007
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using Hostelworld, first time in Venice and aware of how hard it is to get reasonable accomodation, i was prepared to pay more than the usual budget traveller. Was certainly not disapointed with A Tribute to Music, it is ideal in all aspects - location is perfect, 1 min from public taxi, gondolas, 3/4 mins walk from St. Marks Square, surrounded with little restaurants and gift shops, rooms really cosy, authentic and most importantly very clean. All the staff were really friendly and helpful and it was nice to see staff who actually seemed interested in their job and their appearance, and the bosses Daniele and Martina who you will meet at breakfast could not have been nicer.
