I had to pay for a double room as I booked on hostelworld and that worked out at â‚¬90 so it was a bit more expensive as I was on my own on this occasion but at just â‚¬45 B&B in Venice, youll find it hard to beat. It was lovely to be staying in the heart of everthing and watching the other visitors going back on the boats to their far reaching hotels at night ha ha. Stayed in this hotel from 10th June for 3 nights, Highly reccomended, I will be back soon. Thank you from Ireland Daniele and Martina

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: mMopsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and two teenage daughters (16 & 18) for 3 nights. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful with all of our requests. The position was great, and for Venice it was reasonably priced. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations-loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleri90
Reviews.Content: Our stay at a Tribute to Music was awesome. I chose it because of the trip advisor review and I am happy I did. The staff, the room, the cleanliness, the view--all top notch-especially for the price. I don't have anything negative to say. Ask for a room with water view and you will be very satisfied. There is a lot of action going on below but we loved it-people watching, seeing the boats load and unload. At night, it gets peaceful with the street lamps lit and scattered people walking and the sound of the boats hitting against the docks. You can;t beat the proximity to the square and the ease of getting to the hotel (only over 1 bridge with luggage) from train station, take the #41 to Arsenale stop, turn left, go over 1 bridge and it's pon the right. Daniel helped us with recommendations for restaurants-all good. We stayed in 3 hotels-Rome, Florence and Venice and this was the best accomotations -all were for around the same price. Also, great bathroom-spacious, nice tub and new.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean, Comfortable but a shame about the air con.”
Reviews.Author: MaxChester
Reviews.Content: Great central location. Clean, comfortable and very freindly helpful staff (apart form air con saving)I would stay here again .HOWEVER on the first two nights the air con mysteriuosly went off at the same time. It was 32 degrees outside and the hotel was definatley pulling a money saving stint. When we reported this the staff looked puzzled and asked if the key was in the slot properly....which would have washed with us if it hadn't happended on the 2nd night again and to other rooms at the same time. When we confronted the staff the poor girl on reception was enbarassed and gave some poor fib as an explantion. It did not happen on night 3, but the damage had been done by then. I would stay here again but make them aware that I want the air con all night.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSmiffy
Reviews.Content: A real find! Excellent location on the quayside overlooking lagoon, 50mtrs to Arsenale Boatstop. This boat stop also used by water shuttle company "Alilaguna" when travelling from Marco Polo airport (journey 1hr 10mins). Having read previous comments on difficulty in finding some hotels late at night - we arrived 1130pm and found hotel within minutes. Rooms at front of hotel have fantastic views of lagoon with some noise from passenger boats and quayside life in general. However, rooms at rear overlook courtyard and are much quieter. The bathroom, recently refurbished, had both a bath and shower. Continental breakfast served in small breakfast room on first floor by very friendly and helpful staff. In fact, all the staff were so friendly and helpful that it contributed to the enjoyment of our stay in Venice. The reception staff will even arrange a free boat trip to the glass blowing factory on the island of Murano. Well worth the visit - even if it's just or the boat trip!

Reviews.Title: “A Glorious Hotel.....Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonCgirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was spetacular!!!!! 2 thumbs up! Service is friendly & curtious... The location is breathtaking..... The decor is posh and comfortable.....loved the bathrooms. Didn't want to leave the room......with a view of the water & St Marcos no need to leave! ....having a drink and sitting on the balcony was amazing! Definately coming back ......Loved it!!!!!!!! Excellent Place for a Honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Tribute To Music In Venice - Best Hotel In Europe. Bar None.”
Reviews.Author: FrancisJoseph
Reviews.Content: I am from the Toronto area. I went to this hotel while staying in Venice, It was incredible. And I really have been all over the world and Europe...I was more than impressed. A beautiful view, it is situated by St Mark's Square and looks onto the wonderful canal scenery. The hotel is super clean, amazing decor in and outside the rooms, and outstanding staff and service. If you are getting married, book this for your honeymoon. The scenery on the top floor room's balcony will bring you back in time to understand why the counts, Doges, and master poets and artists fell in love with the wonder called Venezia. Book this place, it's worth the money and MORE.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - location !”
Reviews.Author: dianerosk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous -- reasonable price - great location and service. The best service received when traveling throughout Italy ! Ask for the only room with a balcony overlooking the San Marco Basin with a great view of San Giorgio Maggiore across the water and great sunsets. Boats in the dock overnight were somewhat squeaky and there were people gathering - so if you want absolute peace and quiet - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Romantic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: LovesItalyMA
Reviews.Content: We drove into Venice & stopped at a kiosk to help with accomodations,as we had no place to stay. The 4 of us were set up with 2 rooms on the top floor that couldn't have been more breath-taking. The rooms were immaculate & updated with modern fixtures and hot water. Each of the 2 rooms had a patio balcony with views of the great canal & street below. It was very romantic . The breakfast was different in that you were waited on instead of serving yourself. Our Hostess, Martina was great in directions & helping us also confirm our flights. I would definetly recommend A Tribute to Music to others and hope that my husband & I can stay there again. Tammy & Mario Carnevale Peabody, Ma.

Reviews.Title: “Most awesome”
Reviews.Author: Goldenluvr
Reviews.Content: We had the most fabulous time in Venice, thanks to the wonderful staff at A Tribute to Music. Our friends told us about the hotel last fall, but I waited too long to make reservations and the place was booked. I looked elsewhere and everything else in the St Mark's area was so expensive. I kept checking back at their website and they must have had a cancellation because a room became available so I snagged it. Consequently, I couldn't request a lagoon view room but the courtyard we overlooked was charming. The room was oh so beautiful and so very clean! The hand held shower with no shower curtain was my only complaint. Martina, the receptionist, was so helpful! Prior to our arrival I had inquired about a tour at the Doges Palace. Martina got all the info and then even made reservations for me! She truly went above and beyond usual hotel staff helpfulness. Breakfast is the usual rolls, packaged crackers and cookies, cheeses, meats and the most delicious chocolate croissants!Very filling. The front door is locked, you must be buzzed in and the front desk is staffed 24/7. The hotel is small, and as I found out fills quickly during high season so book early! The location is just 2 blocks away from St. Mark's Square, but it's out of the high rent district so it's quite affordable. It was actually the least expensive room we stayed at in 4 cities in Italy! Directions to the hotel, taken from the website were perfect, the most precise of all our reservations. Of all the places we stayed in Italy, this was our favorite. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ash760
Reviews.Content: A brilliant reasonable place to stay. The location could not be better. Everything was a 2 minute walk. The staff were very friendly. The accommodation was a three star standard and was absolutely fine. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Jake042
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a stay at "A Tribute to Music." Our room on the first floor was spacious, well equipped and scrupulously clean. The view over the lagoon was wonderful and we had not expected to be able to afford a hotel in such a prime location in Venice. The Staff were friendly and extremely helpful and this added to the pleasure of the stay. Needless to say we shall be returning later in the year.
